result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Nickelson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leon Nickelson Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel. No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 11-9-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leon Nickelson Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  Defendant did go to the State Public Defender's Office and he does qualify.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leon Nickelson Jr in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leon Nickelson Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Indigency Hearing.  Defendant advises Court that he recently became unemployed.  Court orders defendant to be reevaluated by the Public Defenders office.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with SSC (dob 2/19/1989)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leon Nickelson in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Leon Nickelson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leon Nickelson appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
